lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court reversed a 2015 ruling that a provision in American Express’s contracts with merchants violated federal antitrust law.

headline.print_headline: Ruling for Amex on Antitrust Appeal
headline.main: American Express Can Stop Merchants From Steering Clients to Other Cards

snippet: A federal appeals court reversed a 2015 ruling that a provision in American Express’s contracts with merchants violated federal antitrust law....
abstract: United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit reverses 2015 lower court decision, clearing way for American Express to stop shopkeepers who accept their credit cards from encouraging customers to use rival payments with lower merchant transaction fees; three-judge panel says prior ruling, which found company violated federal antitrust law, did not consider overall customer satisfaction; Justice Dept may appeal.
